name: clefting/splitting of energy wood | clefting of energy wood | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10687/documentation

The inventory refers to 1 productive machine hour (PMH) - referring to the operational time of the machine including breaks up to 15 minutes -  for tractor powered clefting device with a diesel consumption of 7 l/PMH, and an engine power of 80 kW;;;;Productivity depends on the specific circumstances of the harvesting operation and is specified in the respective datasets.;;The following sources have been consulted for the elaboration and plausibilisation of the dataset:;    Anonymous (2004): DIRECTIVE 2004/26/EC OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 21 April 2004 amending Directive 97/68/EC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to measures against the emission of gaseous and particulate pollutants from internal combustion engines to be installed in non-road mobile machinery. Official Journal of the European Union: 30.4.2004;     Lambrecht, U., H. Helms, K. Kuller and W. Knörr (2004): Entwicklung eines Modells zur Berechnung der Luftschadstoffemissionen und des Kraftstoffverbrauchs von Verbrennungsmotoren in mobilen Geräten und Maschinen; Endbericht. IFEU - Institut für Energie- und Umweltforschung Heidelberg GmbH, Heidelberg. ;   Spielmann, M., L. Barreto, V. Erni, F. Frutig and O. Thees (2007): Life cycle assessment of energy wood chip supply chains; a case study of near future supply of forest wood chips in Switzerland (unpublished). Paul Scherrer Institute (PSI), Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research (WSL), Villigen, Birmensdorf.;    

Service beginning with the input of diesel into the tractor powering the clefting device, at forest road.

Includes the input of machinery infrastructure, the input of diesel fuel, lubricants/greases as well as their disposal, and the emissions into air from diesel consumption. Wood is not included in the dataset.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Emission profile according to European legislation
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Motormanual production with a mobile diesel powered clefting device.;;For the production of cleft timber, residual wood (branches, small trees from tending or thinning or misbuilt large diameter trees) are cut into one meter long log pieces, loaded onto a tractor-driven trailer, and transported to the forest road. The logs are split along the grain with a mobile, tractor-powered clefting device; the resulting cleft timber is piled along the forest road for natural drying; small-diameter logs and branches are piled without splitting.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: see Geography This dataset has been derived from Swiss data in an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Material and fuel input from literature sources (see general comments field); air-borne emissions taken from existing dataset on diesel consumption in building machines or - where emission levels beyond applicable European legislation - estimated with emissions model based on emission limits established in European Directive 2004/ 26/EC for non-road mobile machinery types EURO IIIa and IIIb (according to Lambrecht et al 2004 and e.g. applied in Spielmann et al. 2007).

flow.name: clefting of energy wood
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

exchanges.description: emission model calculating hourly specific emissions as "engine power x load factor x base emission factor" as proposed by Lambrecht et al. (2004) and applied in Spielmann et al. (2007);  values for base emission factors for VOC for mobile machinery classes EURO IIIa and EURO IIIb are taken from European Directive 2004/ 26/EC, of which 2.4% are assumed to be methane.

flow.name: Methane, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: emission model calculating hourly specific emissions as "engine power x load factor x base emission factor" as proposed by Lambrecht et al. (2004) and applied in Spielmann et al. (2007); values for base emission factors for particles for mobile machine classes EURO IIIa and EUROIIIb are taken from European Directive 2004/ 26/EC. The proportional distribution accross particle classes is made based on the ecoinvent v3 dataset "Diesel, burned in building machine/GLO".

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: value per MJ taken from ecoinvent 2.2 dataset *diesel in building machine" converted to input of diesel as mass (42.8 MJ/kg lower heating value)

exchanges.description: emission model calculating hourly specific emissions as "engine power x load factor x base emission factor" as proposed by Lambrecht et al. (2004) and applied in Spielmann et al. (2007);  values for base emission factors for NOx for mobile machine class EUROIIIb are taken from the European Directive 2004/ 26/EC; for mobile machine class EURO IIIa values for base emission factors for NOx are calculated based on an assumed reduction of VOC emissions as compared to "Tier 2" limit for VOC of 1.0 g/kWh (following Spielmann et al. 2007).
